text.section: As used in this section, "facility" means a correctional facility of any kind for adults or juveniles.

Another state may not begin construction or otherwise locate a facility in this State unless the other state submits a written request for approval to construct or locate the facility to and receives approval from:
the Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services, in the case of a facility for adults; or
the Secretary of Juvenile Services, in the case of a facility for juveniles.

section.section: The Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services may approve or disapprove a request for approval to construct or locate a facility for adults in this State.
The Secretary of Juvenile Services may approve or disapprove a request for approval to construct or locate a facility for juveniles in this State.

Approval or disapproval shall be:
after consultation with the Governor, the governing body of the county in which the facility will be located, and the community in which the facility will be located; and
in accordance with applicable standards concerning the location of facilities.

text.section:
If another state has an existing facility in this State, the other state may not increase the inmate population of that facility by more than 5% unless the other state first submits a written request for the increase to and receives approval for the increase from:
the Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services, in the case of a facility for adults; or
the Secretary of Juvenile Services, in the case of a facility for juveniles.
